thread.title_full: Cleveland Browns' Johnny Manziel pulled over after arguing with girlfriend ... - NJ.com

title: Cleveland Browns' Johnny Manziel pulled over after arguing with girlfriend ... - NJ.com
text:
Cleveland Browns' Johnny Manziel pulled over after arguing with girlfriend, admitted to drinking NFL: Cleveland Browns at Baltimore Ravens Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was involved in a domestic dispute with his girlfriend. Mandatory Credit: Tommy Gilligan-USA TODAY Sports (Tommy Gilligan) Comments 
Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was stopped by police following a domestic incident with his girlfriend on Monday in Avon, Ohio. 
According to a police report obtained by newsnet5.com , a witness called authorities after seeing Manziel arguing with his girlfriend, TCU student Colleen Elizabeth Crowley, while driving. The argument reached the point where Crowley attempted to exit the vehicle while it was on the road, the witness told police. 
PLUS : Erin Andrews wants $75 million in damages after secret hotel taping 
Crowley said she threw Manziel's wallet out the window and added that he pushed her head into a window, according to the report. Manziel and Crowley admitted to drinking beforehand, though both were not intoxicated enough to be charged by police. 
Manziel spent 10 weeks in rehab during the offseason. The 2012 Heisman winner addressed the incident on Friday via his Twitter account: Colleen and I got into a dumb public argument on the way home Monday afternoon. It probably looked more interesting than it was and... — Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 I know I would stop and check if I saw a couple arguing on the side of the road. It was embarrassing but not serious... — Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 and when we talked to the police and they realized everything was alright and I was sober, we went home together and everything is fine. — Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 16, 2015 
Crowley also released a statement insisting she and Manziel "are good": — Johnny Manziel (@JManziel2) October 17, 2015 

Here's what Browns GM Ray Farmer had to say about the matter: #Browns statement from Ray Farmer on Johnny Manziel pic.twitter.com/TESzEmDmIu — Mary Kay Cabot (@MaryKayCabot) October 16, 2015
